intro: Navarretia leucocephala subsp. plieantha, commonly known as the white-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with slender stems and narrow leaves. This subspecies is often found in coastal and inland habitats, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
